intro: Ctenium brachystachyum, commonly known as the short-stalked ctenium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often with a slightly hairy surface. Ctenium brachystachyum is typically found in open habitats such as grasslands and along coastal areas.
